message.content: {"id": "6009", "title": "Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes", "description": "", "OB": "When using the new class wizard for nested classes, the wizard does not correctly determine the context.", "EB": "When using build 20011106, with a .java file open in the editor, clicking the new class button and checking the 'Enclosing Type' field, it is observed that the field is blank. It is expected that the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.", "SR": "Ensure that the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard defaults to the current type in the editor when creating a nested class."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
